claim: If a late safety car had been deployed after lap 50 on 2015/11/29, at least 13 drivers would have reached the finish.
extra_info: game and race are synonyms; drivers who finished the race should have record in time;
reasoning: The claim is counterfactual — it describes a hypothetical 'what if' scenario ('If a late safety car had been deployed after lap 50'). The database only records what actually happened, not what would have happened under imagined conditions. Counterfactual claims cannot be verified from a database and must be classified as NOT ENOUGH INFO.

content.text:
This claim uses counterfactual language: "If a late safety car had been deployed after lap 50..." This describes a hypothetical scenario that didn't actually happen.

The database records what actually occurred in races, not what would have happened under hypothetical conditions like a late safety car deployment. A counterfactual claim cannot be verified from historical data.
